oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Volunteer Army Ammunition Plant Workers Painting Road Lines
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Embracing Citizenship
Military Service
African Americans; African American women
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A group of seven African American men and women painting road lines.
Military service did not always include participation in the armed services. These men and women were assisting the war effort at the Volunteer Army Ammunition Plant, which created TNT.
oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: Volunteer Army Ammunition Plant Photographs, 194- to 197-, Jeffrey W. Cash, Collector.
